intro: Alsophila excavata, commonly known as the hollow fern, is a species of tree fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk that is often hollow, giving it its common name. The plant has large, feather-like fronds that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical and subtropical forests. Alsophila excavata plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various forest organisms.
